DataElement.preferredName: Breast Disease or Disorder Negation Sign or Symptom Diagnostic Mammography Requirement Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Verification at a particular time that the patient does not have signs or symptoms of any abnormal conditions of the breasts that would require a diagnostic mammogram, as outlined in the study protocol, in order to participate in a clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Disease or Disorder Negation Sign or Symptom Diagnostic Mammography Requirement Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._X-ray of the breasts used to check for breast cancer after a lump or other sign or symptom of breast cancer has been found._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Having been established or verified._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Negation Sign or Symptom Diagnostic Mammography Requirement Confirmation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).:X-ray of the breasts used to check for breast cancer after a lump or other sign or symptom of breast cancer has been found.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:Having been established or verified.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining practitioner (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).
Mammography done after suspicious results on a screening mammogram or after other signs of possible breast cancer.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/10/20 tmt versioned to 2.0 for changes to Long and Short names.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients must not have sympto
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have symptoms or signs of benign or malignant breast disease (eg, nipple discharge, breast lump) warranting a diagnostic rather than a screening mammogram.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have symptoms or signs of benign or malignant breast disease (eg, nipple discharge, breast lump).

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have symptoms or signs of benign or malignant breast disease (eg, bloody or clear nipple discharge, breast lump) based on physician physical exam or self breast exam.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1151 - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must not have new (not previously worked up with imaging) symptoms or signs of benign or malignant breast disease (eg, bloody or clear nipple discharge, breast lump) based on physician physical exam or self breast exam.

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/11/20 CDE versioned for updated VD; tmt. 3/8/17 tt, EA1151.
